data.title: Worth the wait
data.text: Had to take local friends to try this hidden gem. They loved it and will definitely be back! The place was packed but our 15 minute wait went fast. (Wait time can be up to 45 minutes on weekends if you come at peak times: 2 hours after opening up until 1 1/2 hours before closing). Remember that it's a DAY Diner so they're only open until 2:30 weekdays or 3:00 weekends. But, it's a full menu of breakfast & lunch items during the entire time.

data.title: The Best Breakfast
data.text: Simply stated one of the best breakfast's I have had the pleasure to eat. Great service, great selection, nice atmosphere.  Portion size is huge and at a fair price. The Saturday morning we went,  there was already a line to get in and the door was not even open yet. Highly recommended.

data.title: OMG breakfast
data.text: Wowza...wish we had this place where I live...although it's only a 20 minute drive...I'm spoiled OK? Largest sized breakfasts for the best prices and friendly service anywhere on earth...no exaggeration...I have a large appetite and could barely finish my omelette or mound of hash browns...best browns I've had, sliced like no other place I've been. My son loves their  biscuits and gravy. Their biscuits are home made and huge. Great coffee. Sit at the counter...it's far cooler than a table. Love it when waitresses call me hon!

data.title: Ms
data.text: Always clean. Good service and good food. Sandwichs so large that I share one.  Always a pleasure to take friends

data.title: Great breakfast
data.text: I've been here a number of times and have never had a bad experience. The food is very good,always fresh,with large portions,and friendly service. Id like to try the burgers for lunch sometime ( they look delicious)but I enjoy their breakfast so much that I can't get past the breakfast menu.

data.title: Stay in Colorado
data.text: Great food.  Had the pancakes and boy were they good.  Very busy, and seem to be popular with the locals.  Would definitely eat there again when in the area.

data.title: Amazing breakfast!
data.text: We ordered three different breakfast meals at Doug's and all of them were AMAZING!  The portions were enormous and everything was fresh and delicious.  The waitress was great and we left very happy and satisfied.

data.title: Great Breakfast!
data.text: The service & food were excellent. Extra friendly staff, large portions & homemade jam, very reasonable prices. Can't ask for anything else.

data.title: Great breakfast
data.text:
This was our first time here and we were very pleased.
The service was very good.
The food is also very good with some different types of meat available in the omelets etc.
The portions are large but available in smaller servings

data.title: Trip Advisor was right on!
data.text: Dropped by here driving from Cheyenne to Estes Park because of trip advisor recommendation. Was absolutely fantastic!! We were waiting in the parking lot at 7:00a.m. and they opened the doors promptly. Loved the menu, lots of different and local things served. Twists on the regular breakfast items. Food was piping hot and beautifully served! Was beyond our expectation! A gem!!

data.title: Love their breakfast
data.text: So good! You get a lot for your money. Im GF and even though they do not have my bread I still left very satisfied. I forget what its called but the one with balsamic vinegar is sooo good. I only get the small portion and am good.

data.title: Try the Griddle Biscuits
data.text: Doug's Day Diner is our favorite place to eat breakfast after church on Sunday morning. The griddle biscuits with two choices of jelly are so delicious. They come with most menu items, but if not, order it as a side and you won't regret it. Good coffee for the coffee connoisseur in the family. We have tried several items on the menu and have never been disappointed. Sunday mornings are busy so get there early if you don't like to wait in line.

data.title: Great food
data.text: Lots of great food! You might have to wait to be seated it is very busy. Service is good and friendly atmosphere. My favorite is the French toast. Two locations Loveland and ft Collins great

data.title: FABULOUS BREAKFAST PLACE
data.text: I have eaten here 3 times now and have enjoyed it each time.  I usually get the Skinny Papas, but this time I ordered the Carne Asada Papas.  You need to like spicy food to really enjoy this dish as the pork is slow cooked but still has a spicy flavor to it.  I ordered the Country Gravy on top and not the Chile as recommended.  I was wanting a little something sweet so also ordered one Sweet Toast.  The sweet toast really hit the spot and I will have to have that again on my next visit to Loveland.

data.title: Wow, this place is good. All Good.
data.text: It was busy when we arrived around noon on a Sunday, we thought since there is a line it must be a good place to eat and we were right. The wait was supposed to be about 15mins but it was only about 5mins. We got a chair at the counter and had a lovely server, she was very nice. I got a breakfast burrito, and I usually don't get breakfast burritos in restaurants because I like my burritos plain and restaurants usually won't/can't make a plain burrito. My burrito was very good. My boyfriend got the combo of pancakes and sweet toast with bacon. Such good food! All of it! And the bacon was so thick and good. I don't live in the area, but if I'm ever near there again I am definitely going back.

data.title: Weekend Breakfast Go-To
data.text: This place has delicious food at great prices. We enjoy going here early on Saturday mornings to beat the rush and indulge in some fantastic breakfast food. The servers are always so friendly and nice, the food comes out quickly, the location is right down town, portions are great. We love the pancakes, best ones around!

data.title: Doug's is Dynamite
data.text: Love this place for breakfast or lunch. Always great! Always standing room only! Hash brown heaven! Reuben's that rock!

data.title: Best breakfast in the area
data.text: Bacon bacon bacon - wow on the bacon.  Really really good breakfast fare AND you will not leave hungry.  One of my favorite breakfast places in the whole USA.  We love this place.   Great big plates of really good foods, great biscuits and gravy and great green chile.  I want to try all the food. (Some of the photos are from a different Dougs Day Diner)

data.title: Great food fun service
data.text: This is a great place... Very good value.... The entire staff is so much fun... Fast service..... Great location .... Good for the entire family

data.title: Not your ordinary diner
data.text: Talk about robust sandwiches. Excellent. Great flavors and enough to satisfy a big appetite. It's sort of the gourmet version of a traditional diner. Go there. Eat. Enjoy.
